charges.charge_disposition: The deft. is hereby committed to the custody of the U.S. Bureau of Prisons to be imprisoned for a term of one hundred and twenty(120) months on count 1. Deft. to receive credit for time served. (1)

charges.charge_description: 21:846 CONTROLLED SUB-SELL, DISTRIBUTE,OR DISPEN NARCOTICS CONSPIRACY (1)

charges.charge_disposition: The deft. is hereby committed to the custody of the U.S. Bureau of Prisons to be imprisoned for a term of one(1) year and one(1) day on count 1. Deft. notified of right to appeal sentence. Bail exonerated. (1)

Filed JUDGMENT IN A CRIMINAL CASE..for offenses committed on or after 11.1.87..deft and attorney Lawrence A. Barocas present, counts ind. 91-871 is dismissed on motion of the U.S., deft shall pay $50.00 special assessment due immediately., deft is placed on probation for a term of 30 months on counts 1., 1) deft submit to drug urinalysis testing at least once every 60 days; and participate in a drug rehabilitative program, approved by the Probation dept., if so required by the probation officer. Court leaves to discretion of the Probation Dept as to whether defts participation in such program shall be as an outpatient or inpatient but recommends as an outpatient if circumstances permit. 2) that the deft refrain from a ssociating with incorrigible persons sopecifically known felons, and/or users of distributors of drugs. 3) that the deft seek obtain and maintain gainful employment. statement of reasons attached...SAND,J. The deft. admits specifications as charged in petition of violation of probation. The deft. is to enter the Daytop Residential Program and successfully complete the program. (1s)

charges.charge_description: 21:846 CONTROLLED SUB-SELL, DISTRIBUTE,OR DISPEN NARCOTICS CONSIPIRACY (1)

charges.charge_disposition: COUNTS DISMISSED ON MOTION OF THE GOVERNMENT. (1)

The deft. is hereby committed to the custody of the U.S. Bureau of Prisons to be imprisoned for a term of to time already served on count 1. Deft. notified of right to appeal sentence. Bail exonerated. (1)
